page.title: 15Farming continued
page.content: Sheep-mostly welsh mountain speckled face used for store and fat lamb producitn. Draft ewes sold at 3 years of age. Lambing takes place in middle of march. Only 3 farms in winter sheep. Most farmers send animals to lowland areas between October and March. Emphasis on meat produciton but wool is valuable source of income. Cattle- mostly single suckling herds, Hereford - Friesian. One herd of South Devon. Most farmers use stock bulls, but some use is made of Artificial Insemination. On only dairy farm milk is sold to Milk Marketing Baord. Most of the buying and selling is done at local marets, Llandovery, Llangadog, Llanybydder, Sennybridge and Carmarthen. Some fat lambs are sent direct to abattoirs, bulls are usually bought further afield.
